content:
by  David AndersonPublished  November  

Twotime Booker Prize winner John Michael Coetzee wrote his first novel Dusklands in  after reading a remote ancestors account of explorations of southwest Africa by European colonialists PERIOD
It was a deposition that he made to the government of the Cape of Good Hope in  or  Coetzee said PERIOD I used a lot of material from the account in the novel itself. since then Coetzee has become one of the leading South African authors and a strong opponent of what white colonialists he had read about tried to promote  apartheid PERIOD
Coetzee won the  Booker Prize on Oct PERIOD  for his latest book Disgrace. his Life and Times of Michael K. had already earned him the prize in  Coetzee is the first author to win the Booker Prize twice PERIOD
Im delighted to have won the award Coetzee said PERIOD I think at least within the Englishspeaking countries it is the major prize. the Booker Prize rewards the best fiction writer from the United Kingdom and the British Commonwealth PERIOD
Coetzees work deals with the nature of oppression particularly its effect on blacks and women PERIOD His interest lies primarily in the universality of oppression although many of his novels deal with South Africa PERIOD
I think he really attempted to make his second novel Waiting for the Barbarians as generic as possible said physics junior Max Seeley PERIOD
While Julie Schumacher a University associate professor in English compares him to Portuguese writer and Nobel Prize laureate Jos Saramago his novels have often drawn comparisons to Samuel Beckett and Franz Kafka PERIOD
Coetzee is enormously wideranging in terms of what he writes Schumacher said PERIOD His works are the best mix of the intellectual and the poetic. other distinguished winners of the 31yearold Booker Prize are Salman Rushdie and Nobel Prize laureates Nadine Gordimer and William Golding PERIOD
Coetzee was born in Cape Town South Africa in  and grew up on an isolated farm in the semidesert of Karroo PERIOD He attended the University of Cape Town completing his masters degree in  and a doctorate from the University of Texas in  PERIOD
Coetzees first novel was followed by the publication of several scholarly essays but not until his second novel In the Heart of the Country did Coetzee clearly establish his reputation as a writer PERIOD This novel and his next both won the Central News Agency award the top South African literary award in  and  PERIOD
